reviews.text: Could not have picked a better location if we paid five times as much! This hotel was awesome. It's right around the corner from the Rialto Bridge and 5 minutes walk (if you don't get lost) to St Marks. Breakfast was good, bed was comfortable and the room was clean and extremely spacious for European standards. Just beware that there is no lift which is probably the only thing keeping it from being a 3 star hotel (currently 2 star). Would definitely stay here again!!
reviews.title: Perfect location and an unbelievable 2* hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking this hotel, I followed the advice of another reviewer and requested a high floor - to try and get a quiet room as much as to get a view over Venice! We were given a room on the 4th floor as requested however with no lift we had quite a hike to walk up and down each time. This also didn't counter the noise problem - everything from loud voices to clanging of dishes at all hours and of course a squillion church bells.
reviews.title: Noisy but good location

likes.disliked: — Muggy rooms, ineffective air con, noise 24/7

reviews.text: Another issue was that the room was hot and uncomfortably humid. Reception advised that the air conditioning is only turned on by request during off-peak times so we asked specifically for this to occur. Once operational, the air con was not very effective and even after running for several hours, the room wasn't noticeably cooler. Thus we left the windows open for fresh air one night and as there are no flywire screens we had the company of several hungry mosquitos! Also the next morning we found that the main control for our air con (at the front desk) had been turned off.
reviews.title: very impressed!

likes.disliked: — no screens on windows - but common in italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive aspects - the hotel is in a convenient location near the main attractions of Venice. Reception staff were pleasant and easy to deal with, especially allowing us to leave luggage for a couple of hours after checking out. The breakfast options were good however the available quantities were quite small considering the number of guests (eg only a few yoghurt tubs were put out).
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall our experience could have been better as we didn't sleep well and wound up with heaps of mosquito bites. If we returned to Venice we would stay elsewhere; but only after asking questions about air con and noise issues!
reviews.title: Excellent value, good location
Good value for money. Great Location
reviews.text: Just came back from venice and we had a great stay at hotel Bartolomeo! I booked it at the last minute at 70 euros a night and they told us it will be a small double room instead of the standard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the sister hotel, Rio Alto, but upon check-in, the room was not ready so they asked if we could stay here for the night instead.
reviews.title: Great Location. Good Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is definitely in a great location and for the price, the room is clean, quiet, and has all the basic amenities you need.
reviews.title: Good location, bit noisy

likes.disliked: — Some noise although it was not on a noisy street

reviews.text: The downside during our stay? Although there was A/C in the room, it shut off in the evening and we had to call front desk to turn it back on because the room (located on the top floor) was real hot during the night. When we checked in, another customer also complained their A/C shut off as well, so we must have not been the only ones that complained.
reviews.title: Fantastic location in the heart of Venice for a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great if you are on a budget or just passing through for a day or two. It is a basic, clean room but lacks any romantic charm. The next day when we checked into their sister hotel, Rio Alto, I would highly recommend that hotel much better (feel free to see my review on that one).
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel

reviews.text: Last tip - make sure you print out the map on their website. We would have definitely gotten lost without it!! It's tucked away in a small alley.
reviews.title: Wonderful and reasonably priced
